basic.description: This course examines selected themes in post-World War II American cultural history and historiography. Topics for discussion include the development of mass consumption, the postwar rise of the "affluent society," anti-communism, sexuality and gender, the television age, popular music, suburbanization, social upheaval in the 'long sixties', and the culture wars of the 1980s and 1990s. (May be offered jointly with HIST-400.)
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Selected Topics in History III: Postwar,Cold War,& the `American Century': U.S. Culture,1945-Present
